title: Hard Starting When Cold (Diesel)
symptom_short: Diesel engine hard to start when cold

likely_causes.cause: Faulty glow plugs or glow plug control module
Weak battery or insufficient cranking speed
Air in fuel system / fuel drain-back

recommended_checks: Scan for glow plug or control module codes.
Verify battery voltage and cranking RPM.
Check fuel lines and filter housing for air leaks.
safety_warning: Repeated long cranking can damage starter and batteries.

title: Rough Idle or Diesel Misfire
symptom_short: Diesel engine shakes or runs rough at idle
recommended_checks: Check injector balance rates via scan tool.
Monitor fuel rail pressure at idle.
Perform compression or relative compression test if needed.
safety_warning: Severe misfire can damage engine internals if ignored.

title: Black Smoke From Exhaust

likely_causes.cause: Restricted air intake or dirty air filter

recommended_checks: Inspect air filter and intake piping.
Check boost pressure vs commanded boost.
safety_warning: Excessive soot accelerates DPF loading and engine wear.

title: Low Power / Limp Mode (Diesel)
symptom_short: Diesel engine lacks power or enters limp mode
safety_warning: Limp mode may limit speed—avoid highway driving until resolved.

title: Diesel Engine Knock or Rattle

likely_causes.cause: Injector timing or injection quantity issue

recommended_checks: Confirm correct fuel quality and recent fill-up.
If noise persists, stop driving and inspect.
safety_warning: Loud knocking may indicate serious internal damage.

title: EGR Valve Stuck / Flow Fault
symptom_short: Rough idle, smoke, or EGR-related fault codes

likely_causes.cause: Carbon buildup in EGR valve or cooler
EGR actuator or position sensor fault

recommended_checks: Scan EGR commanded vs actual position.
Verify coolant flow through EGR cooler (if equipped).
safety_warning: EGR faults increase emissions and may trigger limp mode.
